This is a really hard review for me to write. I was waiting for it for a long time, and couldn't wait to play it. And so, when I finally did, it started out strong - great retro graphics, good sound, clean controls, mysterious story setup. However, the more you progress, the more the puzzles require some leaps of logic (played on hard mode), and the story loses itself to the point where I was questioning the characters' motivation. I really love the game, and am impressed by what the final product is. Unfortunately, for me it falls apart toward the end, and I won't go into details to avoid spoilers. Do I recommend the game? Sort of. Is the experience worth the price? Definitely. Even if I'm not happy with the last third of the game, everything up to that point is everything you can ask for from a nostalgia-inducing fresh point-and-click adventure.
